comment: BUSA 4150 is an easy P/F class. Assignments all on Suitable. You can work ahead & finish the class as early as you wish. Must attend job fairs! (All over Zoom or Teams because of COVID) Diane Fennig was very rude & discouraging. She's supposed to be a "career coach" when rather she made me feel as if I was behind & dumb. She is not a nice lady.

While this is an easy class, Professor Fennig lacks all skills needed to be an efficient career coach. She is highly opinionated and if you dont have the perfect answer she will consistently fight you on it. The mandatory career coach meeting was nothing short of a joke. No coaching was done, she will put you down on every single choice you've made

Only met her once, but she was really encouraging. She encouraged everyone to meet her at least once. I dont think she provides a syllabus, but if you ask, she might give a layout of the hard deadlines she has. I did all events online and it was simple. Answer the prompts, but do not write an essay. The work is straight forward & simple.

Took her as my "professor" for an online 0 credit class. Never spoke with her in person or through email. It was a pass/fail grade so if you did all the assignments which were super easy you passed, i don't even think she really looks at them.

The format of this course was changed unexpectedly days before the semester started, and it was a disaster. Students weren't informed of the change. Was supposed to be 100% online. When I emailed her regarding schedule conflicts that the new in-person requirements created with my other classes and job, she told me to quit my job. Consistently rude.
Super easy class! I took it online over the summer and finished it in just one weekend. Everyone should pass this course and everyone can finish it very quickly to just get it out of the way.

I took this class for the summer semester, it was doable. Not a lot of work. Very interesting and helpful in my opinion. You work at your own pace, but there are a few hard deadlines. 2 graded videos (intro & prescreening interview), 2 graded assignments + 1 final quiz. Instructor sends weekly reminders, very organized. Timely grading (Pass/fail)

Only teacher that teaches this course for international business majors. You have 3 meetings with her throughout the entire series. She plays devils advocate but that's her way of making sure you have a real plan for your major. I found the class a waste of time but she is not a hard grader. If you do the assignments you'll pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Consider switching your major or dropping out before taking her class. When I told her why I chose my major she told me she hated those reasons, she told me I was wasting my degree because I didn't have a 10 yr plan, and I switched my major just so I wouldn't have to deal with her anymore & She's supposed to be helping us "discover our strengths."
